column2: Frequency: Prior to the commencement of works.
Acceptance Criteria: Each bitumen sprayer used on the works has a current certificate of calibration.
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
• Sand is crushed or natural sand free from significant amounts of clay, organic matter, water or other foreign material and is non-plastic.
• The sand contains only sound, hard, dense, durable and clean particles. The particle size distribution of sand is within the below limits:
Inspection/ Test Method: Inspection, AS 1289.3.3.1 (wet preparation)
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Acceptance Criteria: 10% maximum, and 3% maximum for  weighted average percentage loss after 5 cycles
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.

Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Acceptance Criteria: Not less than 100% by mass of particles must have 2 or more fractured faces
Inspection/ Test Method: RMS NSW Test Method T239 or approved equivalent
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.

Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.

2.09 - Aggregates: accelerated soundness index by reflux (igneous rock only)
Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.

Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Acceptance Criteria: The particle size distribution is within the specified range for the relevant nominal size aggregate shown in Note 1.

Frequency: Within thirty (30) days of notification of the award of the Contract.
Inspection/ Test Method: AS 1141.20.1 or AS 1141.20.2
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Prior to the use of proprietary prime products.
• Proprietary products have proven performance on similar airport or heavy duty pavement applications for at least 5 years.
• Material data sheet, record of proven performance and specification has been submitted to the Contract Administrator.
Record of conformity: Materials data sheet, record of proven performance
Frequency: Each delivery of bituminous primer.
• Primer has not been held at storage temperatures greater than the limits below for more than 6 hours:
• Each stockpile of sand proposed to be used for absorbing excess primer.
• Test certificates to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least fourteen (14) working days before proposed commencement of priming.
Acceptance Criteria: Material complies with Item 2.02 of this ITP.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
• Each stockpile of sand proposed to be used for absorbing excess primer.
• Test certificates to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least fourteen (14) working days before proposed commencement of priming.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
• Each stockpile of aggregates to be used in primer seals.
• Test certificates to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least fourteen (14) working days before proposed commencement of priming.
• The particle size distribution is within the specified range for the relevant nominal size aggregate shown in Note 1.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
• Each stockpile of aggregates to be used in primer seals.
• Test certificates to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least fourteen (14) working days before proposed commencement of priming.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
• Each stockpile of aggregates to be used in primer seals.
• Test certificates to be submitted to Contract Administrator at least fourteen (14) working days before proposed commencement of priming.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each homogenous lot of primer.
Acceptance Criteria: Material complies with AS 2157 specification.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate

• For each delivery of primer, immediately prior to the transfer of primer to storage tanks from the delivery vehicle, and at least once per day that the primer is being stored, or at least once per hour when the primer is being heated.
Frequency: At least one (1) day prior to commencement of work.
• The reference sample is representative of the material to be used in the works and complies in all respects with the requirement of the specification.
• The sample is dividied into two representattive portions. Each portion is not less than one litre.
• At least three (3) working days prior to the proposed commencement of the initial application of prime coat or primer seal.
• Prior notice (minimum two (2) working days) of intention to construct the test area to be given to Contract Administrator.
• Approximately 1000 L of primer and all necessary plant, labour and equipment is available to perform a construction trial of prime coat and/or primer seal.
• Immediately prior to application of primer.
• Prior notice (minimum 2 (two) working days) to be given to Contract Administrator of intention to commence con
• All loose material, excess aggregate, dirt, clay, dust, oil, or any other deleterious substance has been removed from the surface to be primed.
5.02 - Moisture content of surface to be primed.
Frequency: Immediately prior to application of primer.
• The prepared surface is dry and the moisture content within the top 25 mm of the base material is 2% or more below the Modified Optimum Moisture Content.
Frequency: Immediately prior to application of primer.
• The pavement temperature is in excess of 15°C and is likely to remain in excess of 15°C during the entire priming operation.
• The surface is not moist or wet, it is not raining, and rain is not imminent.
Frequency: Immediately prior to the commencement of each spray run.
• The temperature of the primer is at or above the temperatures specified below and has been recorded:
Record of conformity: Spray run sheet, ITP
• Upon filling or refilling the mechanical sprayer with primer and prior to commencing or recommencing spraying.
• Spray nozzles are working correctly and distributing primer evenly when tested on an area other than the pavement to be primed.
Acceptance Criteria: The pavement to be primed has been marked with paint to indicate the line along which the sprayer will drive.
Acceptance Criteria: The application rate is 1.3 L/m2 of surface area, measured at 15°C.
Record of conformity: Certificates indicating binder application rate
5.08 - Application and spread rates: primer seals.
• After each spray run and before the commencement of any subsequent spray run.
• Dippings of the sprayer tank indicate an average application rate of primer on any spray run not less than 92.5% or more than 107.5% of the application rate specified in Note 2.
Record of conformity: Certificates indicating binder application rate
• The location and date of each spray run, together with the actual average application rate of primer, is recorded on a plan of the works and in as-built documentation.
Note 1: Table 5003-5 Primer seal Aggregate Particle Size Distribution
Note 2: Table 5010-2 Primer Seal Spread Rates
